greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Exponent of 2 in 3^n - 1.
comment: Also the 2-adic order of Fibonacci(3n) [Lengyel]. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 05 2008
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
T. Lengyel, The order of the Fibonacci and Lucas numbers, Fib. Quart. 33 (1995), 234-239.
D. Marques, P. Trojovsky, The p-adic order of some fibonomial coefficients, J. Int. Seq. 18 (2015) # 15.3.1, proposition 7
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = e+2 if p = 2; 1 if p > 2. G.f.: A(x) = 1/(1-x^2) + Sum_{k>=0} x^(2^k)/(1-x^(2^k)). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jan 19 2004
G.f.: Sum_{k>=0} t*(1+2*t+t^2+t^3)/(1-t^4) with t=x^2^k. Recurrence: a(2n) = a(n) + 1 + [n odd], a(2n+1) = 1. - _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 23 2004
G.f. A(x) satisfies A(x) = A(x^2) + x/(1-x) + x^2/(1-x^4). - _Robert Israel_, Dec 28 2015
program: (PARI) a(n)=my(t=valuation(n,2)); if(t,t+2,1) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 14 2014
results.author: _Labos Elemer_ and _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 19 2004
